meanings.definition: To take away from the worth or value of something.
meanings.sent1: Talking loudly in the library detracts from others' ability to focus.
meanings.sent2: Leaving trash on the beach detracts from its natural beauty.
meanings.sent3: Eating ice cream with ketchup detracts from the deliciousness.
meanings.sent4: His constant complaints detract from the positive atmosphere of the party.
meanings.sent5: The graffiti detracts from the historical significance of the monument.

meanings.definition: To reduce the strength, success, or importance of something.
meanings.sent1: Skipping breakfast detracts from your energy levels throughout the day.
meanings.sent2: The rainy weather detracted from the excitement of the outdoor event.
meanings.sent3: Wearing mismatched socks detracts from his fashion statement.
meanings.sent4: Her absence detracted from the overall success of the team.
meanings.sent5: The negative comments detracted from her confidence in the presentation.

meanings.definition: To divert or distract attention from something.
meanings.sent1: The magician used a flashy trick to detract from his sleight of hand.
meanings.sent2: The bright neon sign detracted from the simple beauty of the street.
meanings.sent3: His funny dance moves detracted from the seriousness of the meeting.
meanings.sent4: The loud noise outside detracted from her ability to concentrate on her work.
meanings.sent5: The colorful decorations detracted from the plain walls of the room.
